channel.title: OnOptions
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from OnOptions, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Half of wealthy Gen Zers and millennials admit to ‘digital shoplifting,’ rationalizing it with inflation and influencer hacks
item.description: Customers are duping merchants into issuing refunds even if they receive and keep their products.

item.title: One More Reason to Drink Coffee: Recent Research Shows Coffee Directly (and Substantially) Improves Gut Health
item.description: Research shows coffee has a clear diet-microbiome connection.

item.title: Reducing Carbon Emissions Can Increase Revenue by 10 Percent
item.description: Investing in sustainability and decarbonization, when guided by strategy and executed effectively, becomes a business opportunity.

item.title: I’m Afraid To Give Feedback After 2 Employees Threatened Self-Harm
item.description: I’m struggling to coach my team now.

item.title: Afraid of Public Speaking? Here’s How Shark Tank’s Barbara Corcoran Beat It
item.description: Small steps turn into small wins. Eventually, those small wins compound into confidence and courage.

item.title: Pet parents are spending thousands to plan their dog’s perfect vacation through Bark Air’s new luxury concierge service
item.description: Bark Air’s new luxury Companion Concierge service helps more pet parents bring their pups on vacation.

item.title: Before he revolutionized tech with Steve Jobs, Jony Ive wanted to quit Apple. Now he’s forging a new power pairing with OpenAI’s Sam Altman
item.description: Ive has joined Altman at OpenAI to create new AI-native devices.

item.title: This Candidate Declined a Job Offer Over $5,000. The Reason Is Instructive for Any Employer
